thread.title: President Trump rejects ESPN’s offer to fill out NCAA Tournament brackets | For The Win
thread.title_full: President Trump rejects ESPN’s offer to fill out NCAA Tournament brackets | For The Win

author: Jessie Karangu
title: President Trump rejects ESPN’s offer to fill out NCAA Tournament brackets | For The Win
text:
By: Jessie Karangu | February 15, 2017 3:49 pm 
A tradition that began eight years ago is coming to a close. 
President Trump has declined to fill out presidential NCAA Tournament brackets on camera for ESPN. Barack Obama filled out his brackets — men’s and women’s — for ESPN all eight years he was in office. 
The network released a statement on Trump’s decision: 
We expressed our interest to the White House in continuing the presidential bracket. They have respectfully declined. 
White House spokeswoman Hope Hicks told The Washington Post , which broke the story, “We look forward to working with ESPN on another opportunity in the near future.” 
Obama invited ESPN’s Andy Katz to the White House in order to film a segment making his picks for the men’s and women’s NCAA tournaments. But while Obama was a vocal basketball fan and pickup player, Trump has not shown that same level of interest.
